title: "Off Topic" but here's what I've been up to for the past month or so (Dubstep Remix of Taylor Swift)

embed.description: Hey guys, sorry about this however my shtty laptop's CPU isn't holding up against the heavy-duty work of Logic Pro X with too much automation. I am only running on a MacBook Air 11" with the worst specs due to the fact that back then I bought for lease this "regulation" laptop by my (rich kid) school's standards.

body:
Read the description for the full "story" of why it's incomplete.

So what do you guys think?
Any other EDM/specifically Dubstep lovers out there?

replies.body:
Not only is Taylor Swift trash, Dubstep is too.. so it fits.

But high pitched dubstep is to much, that I felt my brain push in on itself and all I wanted to do was kill myself during those 58 seconds.

> [{quoted}](name=Sackboy,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=tanG3LYw,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-03-17T03:20:43.787+0000)
>
> Not only is Taylor Swift trash, Dubstep is too.. so it fits.
> 
> But high pitched dubstep is to much, that I felt my brain push in on itself and all I wanted to do was kill myself during those 58 seconds.

It's called a Screech/Scream synth...
Oh well, dubstep isn't for everyone, and the most important lesson I've learned about making it is that not everyone likes it and you'll tend to get a lot of disrespect for it.

{{champion:112}} - DATS MY MUSIC

> [{quoted}](name=MageBlades,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=tanG3LYw,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-03-17T03:30:14.954+0000)
>
> It's called a Screech/Scream synth...
> Oh well, dubstep isn't for everyone, and the most important lesson I've learned about making it is that not everyone likes it and you'll tend to get a lot of disrespect for it.
> 
> {{champion:112}} - DATS MY MUSIC

I have very.. sensitive ears, anything high-pitched just sends pain through my head, including the goddamn pings in this game.
I did enjoy the start before it went all high-pitched, but yes.. I know what it is as I listened to dubstep for awhile, I progressed into Speedcore and Breakcore, to Gabber and then sat in Lolicore for awhile. I know all about people disliking the genre of music.

> [{quoted}](name=Sackboy,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=tanG3LYw,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2015-03-17T03:35:41.556+0000)
>
> I have very.. sensitive ears,

not sure if i should be attracted or offer a peace offering

> [{quoted}](name=Sackboy,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=tanG3LYw,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2015-03-17T03:35:41.556+0000)
>
> I have very.. sensitive ears, anything high-pitched just sends pain through my head, including the goddamn pings in this game.
> I did enjoy the start before it went all high-pitched, but yes.. I know what it is as I listened to dubstep for awhile, I progressed into Speedcore and Breakcore, to Gabber and then sat in Lolicore for awhile. I know all about people disliking the genre of music.

Then put down the volume lol
I really like loud music and I (personally) love ear piercing synths such as the screech one but then again, everyone has different tastes and preferences.

Perhaps Riot should lower certain frequencies of the pings in-game? I could do that for them if they're too lazy to :P
For the dubstep nerds: No, I didn't use any presets. All my own presets...
